thread.title: Tampa Bay Lightning recall Syracuse Crunch goalie
thread.title_full: Tampa Bay Lightning recall Syracuse Crunch goalie | syracuse.com

author: Lindsay Kramer | lkramer@syracuse.com
title: Tampa Bay Lightning recall Syracuse Crunch goalie
text:
Syracuse Crunch goalie Kristers Gudlevskis is going to get a shot at the Stanley Cup champs.
Gudlevskis was recalled to parent club Tampa Bay on Friday, before the Crunch took on Hartford in the War Memorial. Crunch coach Rob Zettler confirmed the move after the game, won by Hartford 4-3.
Gudlevskis was needed to give Lightning goalie Ben Bishop a rest. Bishop played in Tampa Bay's win at Winnipeg on Friday; Gudlevskis is expected to be in net when the Lightning visits Chicago on Saturday.
The Crunch is in the midst of a three-in-three weekend, traveling to Utica on Saturday and Rochester on Sunday. Adam Wilcox got the start against the Wolf Pack and he was backed up by Allen York, who was recalled from Greenville of the ECHL.
